title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox are reportedly discussing trading reliever Jordan Hicks to acquire an infielder before spring training.
Starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval are also being mentioned in trade talks by the Red Sox.
Boston has shown interest in infielders such as Nico Hoerner, Matt Shaw, and Isaac Paredes.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots linebacker K'Lavon Chaisson expresses desire to re-sign with New England as he enters free agency.
Chaisson had a career year with the Patriots, registering 7.5 sacks, 18 QB hits, and two forced fumbles.
Chaisson credits offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels and interim DC Zak Kuhr for his successful season.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after battling aggressive prostate cancer diagnosed in September.
Williams to travel with the Patriots for Super Bowl LX, his first travel since his diagnosis.
Williams underwent five rounds of chemotherapy and received care at Mass General Hospital.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge endorses Plant Based Treaty, becoming the first Massachusetts city and 66th worldwide to support the initiative.
The treaty aims to negotiate a global agreement for sustainable food systems, complementing the Paris Agreement.
Endorsement promotes awareness, improved health, and reduced emissions; no specific mandates are included in the order.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, known for 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone,' passed away at 71 after a brief illness.
'A Mighty Wind' featuring O'Hara is free to stream on YouTube, highlighting her collaborations with Christopher Guest.
O'Hara's role in 'Schitt's Creek' is streaming on Hulu and Prime Video, portraying the eccentric Moira Rose.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' Coach Mike Vrabel downplays uniform superstition ahead of Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
Patriots choosing white uniforms for Super Bowl LX, with a 5-0 record in white this season.
Historical trends suggest an advantage for teams wearing white in Super Bowl, with a 37-22 record.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: Cape Cod and the Islands will see the most impact from the Atlantic storm, with 2 to 6 inches of snow possible.
Boston and areas west of I-495 will experience minimal effects, potentially receiving only a coating to 1 inch of snow.
Strong winds and potential coastal flooding are expected in Eastern Massachusetts, especially near the Cape, on Sunday.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major trades before Feb. 5 deadline, ESPN reports.
Celtics could trade Anfernee Simons to match salary; he's in final contract year at $27.7 million.
Possible trade target Ivica Zubac would require Celtics to provide Simons, a first-round pick, and a pick swap.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five Boston restaurants, including 89 Charles and Serafina, received all-alcohol licenses under new Massachusetts State Budget legislation.
The Boston Licensing Board approved the first batch of applications allowing beer-and-wine license holders to upgrade to serve spirits.
The new non-transferable licenses were facilitated by a provision in the 2026 Massachusetts State Budget and will not enter the private market.

title: Entangled right whale found dead off North Carolina coast
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 4-year-old North Atlantic right whale named 'Division' was found dead off North Carolina due to fishing gear entanglement.
Division had been entangled since December 2025, suffering severe injuries that worsened his health, NOAA and New England Aquarium confirmed.
The whale's death is the first confirmed North Atlantic right whale fatality since May 2024; poor weather hindered further rescue efforts.
